completedHtmlOnCondition.html:
Thank you for your interest.

Unfortunately, you do not meet the specific criteria required for this particular study.

Thank you!

You have successfully completed the survey. Your feedback is very valuable to us.

elements.name: S1_Age
elements.title: Please enter your age in years.

validators.text: You must be 18 years or older to participate.

elements.name: S2_Country
elements.title: Where do you currently live?

elements.name: S3_Consent
elements.title: Do you consent to your responses being used for confidential market research purposes (anonymised and reported in aggregate)?

elements.name: D_Postcode
elements.title: What is your Australian postcode?
elements.description: Leave blank if you prefer not to say.

validators.text: Please enter a valid 4-digit Australian postcode (e.g., 2000).

elements.name: D_State
elements.title: Region / State / Territory

choices.text: Australian Capital Territory (ACT, incl Jervis Bay)

elements.name: D1
elements.title: What is your gender?

elements.name: D2
elements.title: Highest education completed

elements.name: D3
elements.title: Employment status

elements.name: D4
elements.visibleIf: {D3} = 'Employed full-time' or {D3} = 'Employed part-time' or {D3} = 'Self-employed' or {D3} = 'Business owner'
elements.title: Main industry of work

elements.name: D5
elements.title: Household composition

elements.name: D6
elements.title: Household size

elements.name: D8
elements.title: Housing tenure

elements.name: D9
elements.title: Length of residence at current address

elements.name: D10
elements.title: Do you speak another language other than English at home?

elements.name: D11
elements.title: Religion, if any

elements.name: D13
elements.title: Annual household income before tax (AUD ($))

elements.name: D14
elements.title: Are you the primary bill-payer/financial decision-maker?

elements.name: D15
elements.title: Are you the main shopper/person who does most of the shopping (i.e., groceries etc.)?

elements.name: D16
elements.title: Relationship status

elements.name: D17
elements.title: How interested are you in politics?
elements.description: (The choices below range from 'Very interested' to 'Not interested at all')

elements.name: D18A
elements.title: Are you a member of any of the following organisations?
elements.description: (Please select Yes, No, or Prefer not to say for each item)

elements.name: D19
elements.title: What type of housing do you live in?
choices: House or flat attached to a shop/office/etc.

elements.name: D19_Semi_Stories
elements.title: How many storeys/levels is your semi-detached / row / terrace / townhouse?

elements.name: D19_Flat_Stories
elements.title: Which best describes your flat or apartment block?
choices: Attached to a house (e.g., granny flat)

elements.name: D20
elements.title: Were you born in Australia or overseas?

elements.name: CC1
elements.title: Over the next 12 months, do you think Australia's economy, as a whole, will…

elements.name: CC2
elements.title: Over the next 12 months, do you expect your household's financial situation to…

elements.name: CC3
elements.title: Compared with a year ago, are your regular expenses…

elements.name: CC4
elements.visibleIf: {D3} = 'Employed full-time' or {D3} = 'Employed part-time' or {D3} = 'Self-employed' or {D3} = 'Business owner'
elements.title: How secure do you feel in your current job?

elements.name: CC5
elements.title: How likely do you think it is that Australia will enter a recession in the next 12 months?

elements.name: CC6
elements.title: In the next 6 months, do you expect your household spending to…

elements.name: CC7
elements.title: Thinking about typical current interest rates and lending criteria, how willing would you be to take out a loan in the next 12 months to fund a major purchase (e.g., a car, home renovation, or major appliance)?

elements.name: CC8
elements.title: In the next 6 months, do you expect your ability to save money to…

elements.name: CC9
elements.title: Do you think now is a good or bad time for your household to make a major purchase (e.g., car, large appliance, home improvement)?

elements.name: CC10
elements.title: In the past 3 months, which (if any) have you done to manage household costs?

choices.value: None – I have not made any cutbacks

elements.name: IA1_5
elements.title: How concerned are you about each of the following? (Part 1 of 2)
elements.description: (Please select one level of concern for each item)
rows: Global inflation and cost of living

elements.name: IA6_10
elements.title: How concerned are you about each of the following? (Part 2 of 2)

elements.name: IA11_15
elements.title: Overall, what is your view of the following countries/groups of countries? (Part 1 of 4)
elements.description: (Please select your view for each country/group)

elements.name: IA16_20
elements.title: Overall, what is your view of the following countries/groups of countries? (Part 2 of 4)

elements.name: IA21_25
elements.title: Overall, what is your view of the following countries/groups of countries? (Part 3 of 4)

elements.name: IA26_30
elements.title: Overall, what is your view of the following countries/groups of countries? (Part 4 of 4)

elements.name: PI4
elements.title: Do you support or oppose Australia taking a more active role internationally?

elements.name: PI5
elements.title: Favourability of selected international political leaders
elements.description: Please select your view for each leader.

elements.name: PI5B
elements.title: Favourability of selected international political leaders
elements.description: Please select your view for each leader.
rows: Ursula von der Leyen (President of the European Commission)

elements.name: PI6
elements.title: Which international issues should Australia's leaders prioritise most?

elements.name: PI7
elements.title: How much influence do you think the following groups have on politics and society in Australia?

elements.name: ME1
elements.title: How often do you follow news/current affairs?

elements.name: ME2
elements.title: Where do you get most of your news?

elements.name: ME3
elements.title: Overall, how much do you trust the news you see/hear?

elements.name: ME4_10
elements.title: How much do you trust news from each source?

elements.name: ME12
elements.title: Which of the following paid services do you currently use? Select all that apply.

elements.name: ME13
elements.title: Approximately how many hours did you spend watching TV or streaming TV yesterday?

validators.text: Please enter a whole number without decimals.

elements.name: ME14
elements.title: In the last 3 months, have you attended any of the following?
choices: Bowling / Mini golf / arcade / escape room (or similar)

elements.name: ME15
elements.title: How often do you use social media?

elements.name: PD0
elements.title: Are you registered to vote?
choices: I am not eligible to vote

elements.name: PD1
elements.title: Do you think Australia is heading in the right direction or the wrong direction?

elements.name: PD2
elements.title: What are the top issues facing Australia right now? (Choose up to 3)

elements.name: PD3
elements.title: Which is the single most important issue?
elements.description: (Select one from the issues you chose above)

elements.name: PD4
elements.title: Do you approve or disapprove of the current Federal government's overall performance?

elements.name: PD5_18A
elements.title: What is your view of each of the following?
rows: Leader of the Opposition – Sussan Ley
Leader of the Nationals – David Littleproud
Leader of the Australian Greens – Larissa Waters
Leader of One Nation – Pauline Hanson

elements.name: PD5_18B
elements.title: What is your view of each of the following?
rows: Deputy Leader of the Opposition – Jane Hume

elements.name: PD5_18C
elements.title: What is your view of each of the following?
rows: Shadow Minister for Foreign Affairs – Simon Birmingham
Minister for Health and Ageing – Mark Butler
State/Territory Premier/Chief Minister - Chris Minns / Jacinta Allen / David Crisafulli / Roger Cook / Peter Malinauskas / Jeremy Rockliff / Andrew Barr / Lia Finocchiaro
State/Territory Opposition Leader – Kellie Sloane / Jess Wilson / Steven Miles / Shane Love / Ashton Hurn / Josh Willie / Selena Uibo

elements.name: PD20
elements.title: If a Federal Election were held tomorrow, which party would receive your First Preference / Primary vote?
choices: Liberal Party / Liberal National Party / Country Liberal Party

elements.name: PD12
elements.title: How sure are you about that choice?

elements.name: PD13
elements.title: How much do you trust the Federal Government to manage the national economy?

elements.name: IP1
elements.title: How closely do you follow international politics?

elements.name: IP2
elements.title: How would you describe the current state of global political stability?

elements.name: IP3
elements.title: How much influence do you think large foreign companies and corporations have on politics and government decisions in Australia?

elements.name: IP4
elements.title: How much influence do you believe international political decisions (made by foreign governments) have on Australia?

elements.name: IP5
elements.title: How concerned are you about misinformation or propaganda from foreign governments affecting Australia?

elements.name: IP6
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'Australia should promote democratic values in all of its international political relationships.'

elements.name: IP7
elements.title: Do you think foreign governments are becoming more accountable, less accountable, or staying the same in how they treat their citizens?

elements.name: IP8
elements.title: How confident are you that national political leaders around the world can cooperate effectively on political issues when needed?

elements.name: IP9
elements.title: Which political group or bloc do you believe has the most political influence globally today?
choices: Emerging democratic nations (e.g., India, Indonesia, Brazil)

elements.name: IP10
elements.title: Overall, do you feel global democracy is improving, weakening, or staying the same?

elements.name: IP11
elements.title: How much do international political developments affect Australian politics and society, in your view, if at all?

elements.name: IP12
elements.title: Which of the following is the most important international political issue today, in your opinion?
elements.description: Most important international political issue today (Single)
choices: Influence of multinational corporations in global politics
Foreign interference in other countries' politics (e.g., misinformation, cyber activity)
Competition between major powers (e.g., geopolitical rivalry)
International cooperation to address global challenges

elements.name: FB1
elements.title: In the last week, how many times have you personally, cooked a meal?

elements.name: FB2
elements.title: In the past week, have you bought any of the following? (select all that apply)
choices: High-protein foods/snacks (e.g., protein yoghurt, shakes, bars)
Gut health foods (e.g., kefir, kombucha, fermented foods, pre/probiotic products)
Soft drinks and other sugary drinks
International flavours / spicy foods (e.g., Korean, Mexican, Indian)
Premium treats/indulgence (e.g., fancy ice cream, desserts)
Specialty coffee/tea (cold brew, matcha, bubble tea)

elements.name: FB3
elements.title: How often do you purchase takeaway food?

elements.name: FB4
elements.title: How often do you visit cafés?

elements.name: FB5
elements.title: What would you say your diet most aligns with?
choices: Mixed (I eat a bit of everything)

elements.name: FB6_Meat
elements.title: Compared to a year ago, your meat consumption is…

elements.name: FB7
elements.title: Are you currently trying to reduce your sugar intake?

elements.name: FB9
elements.title: Compared with 12 months ago, would you say your overall eating and drinking habits are:
choices: Not sure / Prefer not to say

elements.name: FB12
elements.title: Over the last week, how often have you eaten each of the following meals at home?
